name: drip
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] If a liquid drips, it falls in drops, or you make it fall in drops: Water dripped down the wall. She dripped paint on the carpet. Synonyms
dribble (FLOW SLOWLY)
drizzle (POUR)
trickle down, from, out of, etc. something
[ I ] to produce drops of liquid: Watch out - the candle's dripping.

drip noun
(LIQUID)
[ C ] a drop of liquid: drips of paint/sweat
[ S ] the sound or action of liquid falling in drops: All I could hear was the drip of the rain from the roof. Synonyms
dribble (SLOW FLOW)
rivulet literary
trickle (LIQUID)
Brian Hagiwara/DigitalVision/GettyImages
[ C ] (US also IV) a method of slowly giving someone liquid medicine or food through a tube into a vein, or a piece of equipment for doing this: He was on a drip for three days.
